Completely analogous to #15157.

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

|Files|Import difference|

`Mathlib.Algebra.Category.HopfAlgebraCat.Basic` `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Shift.ShiftedHom` `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Shift.Pullback`</details>|9|
|<details><summary>10 files</summary> `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Enriched.Basic` `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Monoidal.Types.Basic` `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Monoidal.Internal.Types` `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Monoidal.Types.Coyoneda` `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Monoidal.Types.Symmetric` `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Functor.FunctorHom` `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Closed.Enrichment` `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Closed.FunctorToTypes` `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Limits.FintypeCat` `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Enriched.Ordinary`</details>|11|

| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Closed.Zero`|17|
|<details><summary>4 files</summary> `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Closed.Functor` `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.ChosenFiniteProducts.Cat` `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.ChosenFiniteProducts` `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Closed.Cartesian`</details>|18|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Limits.Constructions.FiniteProductsOfBinaryProducts`|26|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Limits.Preserves.Shapes.Products`|158|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Cofan.isColimitMapCoconeEquiv`
`+ Cofan.isColimitYonedaEquiv`
`+ Cofan.map`
`+ Fan.isLimitCoyonedaEquiv`
`+ Fan.isLimitMapConeEquiv`
`+ Fan.map`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This is a large import, but it brings the imports in line with `CategoryTheory.Limits.Preserves.Shapes.Pullbacks`, so I wouldn't consider this importing too much. In general the import structure and also the placement of results in this area of the library is rather chaotic (which isn't too surprising since it's quite old). There are files like `Limits.Opposites` which bind all of the special shapes together quite early in the import structure. I'll look into splitting `Limits.Opposites` and perhaps other files so that the special shapes can be developed for longer without knowing about each other. Not in this PR though.

pullRequest.title: feat: a fan is limit iff it is after the application of coyoneda.obj X
